ygData.subject: Re: This and That
ygData.msgSnippet: Do you have any idea what race or class you want to be? http://eq.stratics.com/ http://everquest.gamestats.com/ http://www.eqatlas.com/
ygData.messageBody:
Do you have any idea what race or class you want to be?
http://eq.stratics.com/
http://everquest.gamestats.com/
http://www.eqatlas.com/
http://www.everlore.com/

these are some of my fav sites. It has been very important to me to learn
how to use my sense heading and LOC buttons. I get lost easily, in reallife
and these keep me from being so lost in EQ. I am new to EQ also but am
addicted!!!
sherri
semosier@...

>From: Brangvyne@...
>
>Salutations All!
>It has been a bit since I have posted asking for some input on getting the
game Ever Quest. I do appreciate the input I got and I did end up buying the
game a few weeks ago. However, with one thing and another I did not get it
installed onto my computer until today and as of right now I still have not
signed on. That will probably be tomorrow sometime.
>Anyway, now that I am actually on the verge of getting started I had a
couple of questions I was hoping some of you might help answer.
>1.) The tutorial that is included on the CD keeps locking up. Did anyone
else have this problem? It has me a bit worried in that I am afraid that the
game might do the same thing. It always happens shortly after leaving the
guildmaster to go get some food. Any input, or suggestions?
>I will be contacting the website to see if they might know why but was
wondering if any of you had the same problem.
>2.) Can anyone give me some suggestion on where to start or what to do
first? Some suggestions from those who have been there and done that might
be helpful/useful?
>3.) Anyone looking for a trainee or companion to go adventuring with. I
plan on trying to start with a half-elf bard, and am looking forward to
doing some adventuring with someone or several someones if anyone is
interested in taking on a beginner.
>Well, I hope everyone had a good Christmas and look foward to chating a bit
and seeing some of you in the world of EQ.
>Happy Adventuring,
>Brangvyne
>
>>
